actors.name: United States of America
actors.description: Global superpower with dominant military, economic, technological, and cultural influence. Leader in international diplomacy and global finance.

sub_actors.name: Executive Branch
sub_actors.description: Led by the President, controls federal execution of laws, foreign policy, military command, and federal agencies. Primary driver of national policy and international relations.

sub_actors.name: Federal Reserve System
sub_actors.description: Central banking system controlling monetary policy, interest rates, and financial stability. Crucial influence over US and global economy.

sub_actors.name: Department of Defense
sub_actors.description: Controls world's largest military force, manages national security, overseas operations, and massive defense budget. Key to global power projection.

sub_actors.name: Congress
sub_actors.description: Legislative branch with power over federal laws, budget, taxation, and oversight of executive branch. Crucial for domestic and foreign policy.

sub_actors.name: Silicon Valley Tech Giants
sub_actors.description: Collective influence of major technology companies (Apple, Google, Meta, etc.) driving innovation, economy, and global digital infrastructure.

sub_actors.name: Wall Street Financial Sector
sub_actors.description: Major financial institutions and markets centered in NYC, controlling vast economic resources and influencing global financial flows.

sub_actors.name: Intelligence Community
sub_actors.description: Network of 18 intelligence organizations including CIA, NSA, gathering and analyzing intelligence crucial for national security decisions.

sub_actors.name: Supreme Court
sub_actors.description: Highest judicial authority interpreting Constitution, settling federal disputes, and shaping fundamental national policies and rights.

actors.name: People's Republic of China
actors.description: Economic powerhouse, largest population, rising military power, and key player in global supply chains and technology development.

sub_actors.name: Chinese Communist Party (CCP)
sub_actors.description: Ruling political party that controls all aspects of governance, policy-making, and strategic direction of China. Central to all decision-making and power structures in the country.

sub_actors.name: People's Liberation Army (PLA)
sub_actors.description: Armed forces of China, including army, navy, air force, and strategic missile forces. Responsible for national defense and maintaining internal security under party control.

sub_actors.name: State Council
sub_actors.description: Chief administrative authority of China, responsible for implementing policies, managing economy, and overseeing government ministries. Led by the Premier.

sub_actors.name: Ministry of State Security
sub_actors.description: Principal intelligence and security agency, responsible for counter-intelligence, foreign intelligence, and internal security maintenance.

sub_actors.name: Central Bank of China (People's Bank of China)
sub_actors.description: Controls monetary policy, regulates financial institutions, and manages the world's largest foreign exchange reserves.

sub_actors.name: State-Owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission
sub_actors.description: Oversees and manages state-owned enterprises, controlling trillion-dollar assets and key strategic industries.

sub_actors.name: National Development and Reform Commission
sub_actors.description: Formulates and implements strategies of economic and social development, controls pricing, and manages investment projects.

sub_actors.name: Guangdong Provincial Government
sub_actors.description: Most economically powerful province, drives innovation and manufacturing, major contributor to national GDP and international trade.

actors.name: European Union
actors.description: Powerful economic bloc, regulatory trendsetter, and influential diplomatic force representing 27 member states.

sub_actors.name: European Commission
sub_actors.description: Executive branch and primary legislative initiator of the EU, responsible for proposing and implementing EU laws, policies, and budget. Represents EU interests as a whole rather than individual member states.

sub_actors.name: Germany
sub_actors.description: Largest economy and most populous member state, wielding significant political and economic influence in EU decision-making. Key driver of EU policy, particularly in economic and fiscal matters.

sub_actors.name: European Central Bank
sub_actors.description: Controls EU monetary policy, manages the euro, and supervises banking systems. Critical for Eurozone stability and economic governance.

sub_actors.name: European Parliament
sub_actors.description: Directly elected EU body with legislative, supervisory, and budgetary responsibilities. Key democratic institution representing EU citizens and co-legislating with Council.

sub_actors.name: Council of the European Union
sub_actors.description: Voice of EU member governments, adopts laws and coordinates policies. Essential forum where national ministers from each EU country meet to adopt laws and coordinate policies.

sub_actors.name: France
sub_actors.description: Major political and economic power, crucial for EU integration and policy-making. Strong influence on EU foreign policy and defense initiatives.

sub_actors.name: Eurogroup
sub_actors.description: Informal body of finance ministers from Eurozone countries, coordinating economic policies and managing euro-related issues. Critical for Eurozone governance.

sub_actors.name: European Court of Justice
sub_actors.description: Supreme court in matters of EU law, ensuring uniform interpretation and application across member states. Shapes EU legal framework and integration.

actors.name: Apple Inc.
actors.description: Tech giant with massive market influence, leading innovation in consumer technology and digital ecosystems.

sub_actors.name: Tim Cook
sub_actors.description: CEO of Apple Inc., primary decision maker and strategic leader who has maintained Apple's position as the world's most valuable company, driving major initiatives in services, privacy, and environmental sustainability

sub_actors.name: iPhone Division
sub_actors.description: Core product division responsible for Apple's flagship product, generating majority of company revenue and driving innovation in mobile technology, cameras, and chip design

sub_actors.name: Apple Services
sub_actors.description: Rapidly growing division managing App Store, Apple Music, iCloud, Apple TV+, and other digital services, representing crucial revenue growth sector

sub_actors.name: iOS Software Engineering
sub_actors.description: Critical division responsible for developing and maintaining iOS, the software backbone of iPhone and iPad, essential for Apple's ecosystem lock-in strategy

sub_actors.name: Apple Silicon
sub_actors.description: Chip design division creating proprietary processors for Apple devices, providing significant competitive advantage and performance improvements

sub_actors.name: Board of Directors
sub_actors.description: Governing body providing oversight and strategic guidance, including major shareholders and influential business leaders

sub_actors.name: Apple Design Team
sub_actors.description: Elite industrial design group responsible for Apple's distinctive product aesthetics and user experience, key to brand identity

sub_actors.name: Apple Retail
sub_actors.description: Global retail operation managing Apple Stores, crucial for brand experience, product sales, and customer service worldwide

actors.name: United Nations
actors.description: Primary international organization for global governance, peacekeeping, and international cooperation.

sub_actors.name: UN Security Council
sub_actors.description: Primary decision-making body for international peace and security, with power to issue binding resolutions and authorize military action. Consists of 5 permanent and 10 rotating members.

sub_actors.name: UN General Assembly
sub_actors.description: Main deliberative body where all 193 member states have equal representation. Sets policies, budget, and makes recommendations on international issues.

sub_actors.name: UN Secretary-General
sub_actors.description: Chief administrative officer and top diplomat of the UN, responsible for implementing strategic vision and representing the organization globally.

sub_actors.name: ECOSOC
sub_actors.description: Economic and Social Council coordinating economic, social, and environmental work of UN agencies and bodies. Central platform for sustainable development.

sub_actors.name: UNDP
sub_actors.description: United Nations Development Programme, leading agency for international development, poverty reduction, and achieving Sustainable Development Goals.

sub_actors.name: WHO
sub_actors.description: World Health Organization, specialized agency directing international health policy and coordinating global health responses.

sub_actors.name: UN Peacekeeping Operations
sub_actors.description: Department managing all peacekeeping missions worldwide, deploying military and civilian personnel to conflict zones.

sub_actors.name: UNICEF
sub_actors.description: United Nations Children's Fund, leading global organization for children's rights and welfare, operating in 190 countries.

actors.name: Federal Reserve System
actors.description: Central bank of the US with enormous influence over global financial markets and monetary policy.

sub_actors.name: Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC)
sub_actors.description: Primary monetary policymaking body that sets key interest rates and directs open market operations. Consists of 12 voting members and significantly influences US monetary policy and global financial markets.

sub_actors.name: Board of Governors
sub_actors.description: Seven-member governing body that guides overall Fed policy, supervises banks, and implements regulations. Appointed by the President and confirmed by Senate for 14-year terms.

sub_actors.name: Federal Reserve Bank of New York
sub_actors.description: Most influential of the 12 Reserve Banks, conducts open market operations, supervises major banks, and manages foreign exchange operations. Permanent FOMC voting member.

sub_actors.name: Federal Reserve Chair
sub_actors.description: Chief executive officer of the Federal Reserve, primary spokesperson, and key decision maker for monetary policy. Chairs both Board of Governors and FOMC.

sub_actors.name: Division of Monetary Affairs
sub_actors.description: Provides critical analysis and research supporting monetary policy decisions, prepares economic forecasts, and develops policy options for FOMC consideration.

sub_actors.name: Federal Reserve Bank Presidents
sub_actors.description: Heads of the 12 regional Reserve Banks who participate in FOMC meetings and provide regional economic insights. Five serve as voting members on rotation.

sub_actors.name: Division of Bank Supervision and Regulation
sub_actors.description: Oversees bank holding companies, state member banks, and international banking operations. Develops and implements banking regulations and policies.

sub_actors.name: Federal Advisory Council
sub_actors.description: Twelve-member advisory body consisting of banking industry representatives who consult with and advise the Board of Governors on banking and economic matters.

actors.name: NATO
actors.description: Powerful military alliance ensuring collective defense and security cooperation among 30 nations.

sub_actors.name: North Atlantic Council (NAC)
sub_actors.description: Principal political decision-making body of NATO, consisting of permanent representatives from all member states. Has ultimate authority on major policy decisions and strategic direction.

sub_actors.name: United States Military Command
sub_actors.description: Largest military contributor to NATO, providing significant personnel, equipment, and funding. Maintains strategic nuclear deterrence and leads many major operations.

sub_actors.name: Supreme Allied Commander Europe (SACEUR)
sub_actors.description: Top military commander responsible for all NATO military operations. Leads Allied Command Operations and serves as strategic military leader.

sub_actors.name: NATO Secretary General
sub_actors.description: Chief spokesperson and head of the NATO organization, responsible for steering decision-making processes and representing NATO internationally.

sub_actors.name: Allied Command Operations (ACO)
sub_actors.description: Primary operational military command responsible for planning and executing all NATO military operations worldwide.

sub_actors.name: Nuclear Planning Group (NPG)
sub_actors.description: Senior body on nuclear policy issues, coordinates NATO's nuclear deterrence strategy and capabilities among member states.

sub_actors.name: European Member States Collective
sub_actors.description: Core European NATO members who provide significant military capabilities, funding, and strategic territory for NATO operations and defense planning.

sub_actors.name: NATO International Staff
sub_actors.description: Permanent executive body supporting NATO's political decision-making process and implementing policies and decisions.

actors.name: Microsoft Corporation
actors.description: Dominant force in enterprise software, cloud computing, and digital infrastructure globally.

sub_actors.name: Satya Nadella
sub_actors.description: CEO of Microsoft since 2014, driving cloud-first strategy and major acquisitions like LinkedIn and GitHub. Key architect of Microsoft's modern transformation and cloud dominance.

sub_actors.name: Microsoft Azure
sub_actors.description: Cloud computing platform generating over $100B in revenue, competing directly with AWS. Core driver of Microsoft's growth and enterprise strategy.

sub_actors.name: Microsoft 365
sub_actors.description: Flagship productivity suite including Office, Teams, and cloud services. Primary revenue generator and enterprise software standard globally.

sub_actors.name: Xbox Gaming Division
sub_actors.description: Gaming and entertainment division managing Xbox platform, Game Pass service, and major gaming studios. Strategic entertainment and consumer technology segment.

sub_actors.name: Board of Directors
sub_actors.description: Primary governance body setting strategic direction, including industry veterans and major shareholders. Key decision-makers for acquisitions and major initiatives.

sub_actors.name: Microsoft Research
sub_actors.description: Advanced technology research division driving innovation in AI, quantum computing, and emerging technologies. Critical for maintaining technological leadership.

sub_actors.name: LinkedIn Corporation
sub_actors.description: Professional networking subsidiary acquired for $26.2B, providing crucial professional data and enterprise services integration.

sub_actors.name: GitHub
sub_actors.description: Developer platform subsidiary serving millions of developers globally. Strategic asset for developer relations and open-source leadership.

actors.name: Russian Federation
actors.description: Major military power with significant energy resources and geopolitical influence.

sub_actors.name: Office of the President
sub_actors.description: Central executive authority led by the President, wielding extensive constitutional powers over domestic and foreign policy, military command, and federal appointments

sub_actors.name: Federal Security Service (FSB)
sub_actors.description: Primary security and intelligence agency, responsible for internal security, counterintelligence, and surveillance, with extensive influence over domestic policy and control

sub_actors.name: Russian Armed Forces
sub_actors.description: Military organization responsible for national defense, comprising ground forces, aerospace forces, and navy, with significant influence on foreign policy and national security decisions

sub_actors.name: Gazprom
sub_actors.description: State-controlled energy corporation controlling majority of Russia's natural gas reserves and export infrastructure, key instrument of economic and foreign policy

sub_actors.name: United Russia Party
sub_actors.description: Dominant political party supporting presidential policies, controlling majority in parliament and regional governments, key mechanism for political control

sub_actors.name: Russian Orthodox Church
sub_actors.description: Dominant religious institution with significant cultural and political influence, supporting state policies and shaping public opinion

sub_actors.name: Rosneft
sub_actors.description: State-owned oil company controlling significant portion of Russia's oil production and exports, major source of state revenue and international influence

sub_actors.name: Ministry of Foreign Affairs
sub_actors.description: Responsible for implementing foreign policy, diplomatic relations, and representing Russian interests internationally

actors.name: World Trade Organization
actors.description: Global body governing international trade relations and economic cooperation.

sub_actors.name: Ministerial Conference
sub_actors.description: Highest decision-making body of the WTO, comprising all member states' representatives, meeting every two years to make fundamental policy decisions and set the organization's direction

sub_actors.name: General Council
sub_actors.description: Conducts day-to-day operations and decision-making between Ministerial Conferences, consisting of member states' ambassadors and delegates who implement policies and oversee WTO functions

sub_actors.name: Dispute Settlement Body
sub_actors.description: Authoritative body handling trade disputes between member nations, enforcing WTO agreements and maintaining international trade order through binding decisions

sub_actors.name: Director-General Office
sub_actors.description: Executive leadership headed by the Director-General, responsible for organizational management, strategic direction, and representing WTO in global affairs

sub_actors.name: Trade Negotiations Committee
sub_actors.description: Oversees and coordinates all trade negotiations between member states, particularly during major rounds of multilateral trade talks

sub_actors.name: Council for Trade in Goods
sub_actors.description: Specialized council overseeing agreements related to trade in goods, including tariffs, non-tariff measures, and other trade regulations

sub_actors.name: Trade Policy Review Body
sub_actors.description: Conducts regular reviews of member countries' trade policies and practices, ensuring transparency and compliance with WTO agreements

sub_actors.name: Committee on Trade and Development
sub_actors.description: Focuses on interests of developing countries within the WTO system, addressing special needs and promoting integration into global trade
